Package api.gbuild.component.button

This package includes all the types of buttons that can be used to construct complex components.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    GButton
    Component defined as a clickable button This class is the definition of a button that can be selected and incorporates an effect on which the color of a component of the button would change wether user is hovering it.
    GButtonClose
    Button with the shape of a close button This button is a set of components that formed an square rectangle with an x inside it that should be associated to an event for closing the component.
    GButtonEmpty
    Button which has no content inside This is an implementation of a button which does not include any additional component inside it.
    GButtonOption
    Button which is a clikable option This type of button is the equivalent of a clickable button with a text inside of it that has associated a key value.
    GButtonWithText
    Button with a text component This is the implementation of a button which contains a text component inside it

Package api.gbuild.component.button Description

This package includes all the types of buttons that can be used to construct complex components.

Since this library is not intended to manage internally I/O events, this buttons cannot activate mouse or key events. However, gBuild offers some methods which returns useful information that can be used at Processing sketches to know when an user has activated an event since some conditions has been met

Since:
1.0.0
Version:
2.0.1
